concept.description: A fixed version of java:MethodOverrides that works even for overrides of methods declared in the JDK, which apparently don't have a name in the graph. That's not important because the name is included in the signature.
concept.cypher: MATCH (type:Type)-[:DECLARES]->(method:Method), (superType:Type)-[:DECLARES]->(otherMethod:Method), (superType)-[:ASSIGNABLE_FROM]->(type) WHERE method.signature = otherMethod.signature AND method.visibility <> 'private' MERGE (method)-[:OVERRIDES]->(otherMethod) RETURN method AS OverriddenMethod, type AS DeclaringType, superType AS SuperType

concept.description: Contributes additional metadata to the :Type nodes.
concept.cypher: MATCH (type:Type) SET type.nameWithoutContainingTypeName = SPLIT(type.name, "$")[-1] RETURN type

concept.description: Contributes the :Anonymous label to anonymous types
concept.cypher: MATCH (type:Type) WHERE type.name =~ ".*\\$[0-9]+$" SET type:Anonymous RETURN type

concept.description: Contributes the :Generated label to generated types
concept.cypher: MATCH (type:Type) WHERE type.name =~ ".*_\\$(logger|bundle)$" SET type:Generated RETURN type

concept.description: Contributes the :Spi and :Public labels to SPI types
concept.cypher: MATCH (type:Type) WHERE NOT type:Test AND type.fqn =~ ".*\\.spi\\..*" AND type.visibility = "public" SET type:Spi, type:Public RETURN type

concept.description: Contributes the :Impl label to implementation types
concept.cypher: MATCH (type:Type) WHERE NOT type:Test AND type.fqn =~ ".*\\.impl\\..*" // Apache HTTP Client uses an impl package, but puts public classes in there... Such as the client builder. AND NOT type.fqn STARTS WITH "org.apache.http.impl." OR type.visibility <> "public" SET type:Impl RETURN type

concept.description: Contributes the :Test label to :Type nodes that exist for test purposes only.
concept.cypher: MATCH (type:Type)<-[:CONTAINS]-(artifact:Maven:Artifact) WHERE artifact.type = "test-jar" OR artifact.name =~ "hibernate-search-integrationtest-.*" OR artifact.name =~ "hibernate-search-util-internal-test.*" OR artifact.name =~ "hibernate-search-util-internal-integrationtest.*" SET type:Test RETURN artifact

concept.description: Contributes the :Api and :Public labels to API types
concept.cypher: MATCH (type:Type) WHERE NOT type:Test AND NOT type:Impl AND NOT type:Spi SET type:Api, type:Public RETURN type

concept.description: Contributes the :HibernateSearch label to :Maven:Artifact, :Package and :Type nodes from Hibernate Search.
concept.cypher: MATCH (package:Package)-[:CONTAINS]->(type:Type)<-[:CONTAINS]-(artifact:Maven:Artifact) WHERE artifact.name =~ "hibernate-search-.*" SET artifact:HibernateSearch, package:HibernateSearch, type:HibernateSearch RETURN type

concept.description: Contributes the :Util label to :Maven:Artifact nodes representing utils artifacts.
concept.cypher: MATCH (artifact:Maven:Artifact:HibernateSearch) WHERE artifact.name =~ ".*-util-.*" SET artifact:Util RETURN artifact

concept.description: Contributes the :IntegrationTest label to :Maven:Artifact nodes representing integration testing artifacts.
concept.cypher: MATCH (artifact:Maven:Artifact:HibernateSearch) WHERE artifact.name =~ ".*-integrationtest-.*" OR artifact.name = "hibernate-search-documentation" SET artifact:IntegrationTest RETURN artifact

concept.description: Contributes additional metadata to the :Maven:Artifact:HibernateSearch nodes.
concept.cypher: MATCH (artifact:Maven:Artifact:HibernateSearch) SET // Assign a keyword to each module artifact.moduleSpecificKeyword = CASE artifact.name WHEN 'hibernate-search-backend-lucene' THEN 'Lucene' WHEN 'hibernate-search-backend-elasticsearch' THEN 'Elasticsearch' WHEN 'hibernate-search-backend-elasticsearch-aws' THEN 'ElasticsearchAws' WHEN 'hibernate-search-mapper-pojo-base' THEN 'Pojo' WHEN 'hibernate-search-mapper-javabean' THEN 'JavaBean' WHEN 'hibernate-search-mapper-orm' THEN 'HibernateOrm' ELSE 'UNKNOWN-MODULE-SPECIFIC-KEYWORD-PLEASE-UPDATE-JQASSISTANT-RULES' END RETURN artifact

constraint.description: API/SPI types must not extend/implement internal types.
API/SPI methods must not expose internal types.
constraint.cypher:
// return values MATCH (type:Type:Public)-[:DECLARES]->(method)-[:RETURNS]->(returntype:Type:Impl) WHERE (method.visibility="public" OR method.visibility="protected") RETURN method
// parameters UNION ALL MATCH (type:Type:Public)-[:DECLARES]->(method)-[:HAS]->(parameter)-[:OF_TYPE]->(parametertype:Type:Impl) WHERE (method.visibility="public" OR method.visibility="protected") RETURN method

constraint.description: API/SPI fields must not expose internal types.
constraint.cypher: MATCH (type:Type:Public)-[:DECLARES]->(field)-[:OF_TYPE]->(fieldtype:Type:Impl) WHERE (field.visibility="public" OR field.visibility="protected") RETURN field

MATCH (type:Type:Public:HibernateSearch)-[:DECLARES]->(method:Method) WHERE method.name =~ "^(get|set).+" AND (method.visibility="public" OR method.visibility="protected") // Exceptions AND NOT (method:Deprecated) AND NOT (method)-[:OVERRIDES]->() AND NOT method.name STARTS WITH "getOrCreate" AND NOT type.name ENDS WITH "Provider" AND NOT type.name ENDS WITH "ConfigurationProperty" AND NOT type.name ENDS WITH "ConfigurationPropertySource" RETURN type, method

constraint.description: API types must not extend/implement SPI types.
API methods must not expose SPI types.
constraint.cypher:
// return values MATCH (type:Type:Api)-[:DECLARES]->(method)-[:RETURNS]->(returntype:Type:Spi) WHERE (method.visibility="public" OR method.visibility="protected") // Exclude extensions from SPI leak rules: they are *meant* to allow SPI leaks AND NOT type.name =~ ".*Extension" RETURN method
// parameters UNION ALL MATCH (type:Type:Api)-[:DECLARES]->(method)-[:HAS]->(parameter)-[:OF_TYPE]->(parametertype:Type:Spi) WHERE (method.visibility="public" OR method.visibility="protected") // Exclude extensions from SPI leak rules: they are *meant* to allow SPI leaks AND NOT type.name =~ ".*Extension" RETURN method

constraint.description: API fields must not expose SPI types.
constraint.cypher: MATCH (type:Type:Api)-[:DECLARES]->(field)-[:OF_TYPE]->(fieldtype:Type:Spi) WHERE (field.visibility="public" OR field.visibility="protected") RETURN field

constraint.description: Types must not depend on implementation types from other modules. SPIs must be used for such dependencies. Exceptions are allowed only when the dependency type is in a util module, or the depending type is a test type.
constraint.cypher: MATCH (artifact1:Maven:Artifact)-[:CONTAINS]->(type1:Type)-[:DEPENDS_ON]-> (type2:Type:Impl)<-[:CONTAINS]-(artifact2:Maven:Artifact) WHERE artifact1 <> artifact2 // Exceptions AND NOT type1:Test AND NOT artifact2:Util RETURN artifact1, type1, artifact2, type2

constraint.description: The 'Impl' suffix should only be used when naming classes that are the only implementation for a given Hibernate Search interface (excluding its own subclasses). Whenever multiple implementations exist, a more meaningful name should be given to the implementation.
constraint.cypher: // Hibernate Search classes named "<prefix>Impl" MATCH (implementingTypeEndingWithImpl:Class:HibernateSearch) WHERE implementingTypeEndingWithImpl.nameWithoutContainingTypeName =~ ".*Impl$" // The interface they implement, named "<prefix>" (if any) OPTIONAL MATCH (implementingTypeEndingWithImpl)-[:IMPLEMENTS|EXTENDS *]->(implementedType:Interface:HibernateSearch) WHERE implementingTypeEndingWithImpl.nameWithoutContainingTypeName = (implementedType.nameWithoutContainingTypeName + "Impl") // All the implementing types that do not extend implementingTypeEndingWithImpl OPTIONAL MATCH (topLevelImplementingType:Class)-[:IMPLEMENTS|EXTENDS *]->(implementedType) WHERE NOT topLevelImplementingType:Test // Ignore stubs AND NOT (topLevelImplementingType)-[:EXTENDS *]->(implementingTypeEndingWithImpl) WITH implementingTypeEndingWithImpl, implementedType, count(distinct topLevelImplementingType) AS topLevelImplementingTypeCount WHERE implementedType IS NULL OR topLevelImplementingTypeCount > 1 RETURN implementingTypeEndingWithImpl, implementedType

constraint.description: The 'Abstract' prefix should be used on abstract types. Exceptions are allowed when: - the abstract type doesn't implement any Hibernate Search interface, or just interfaces from a util module, in which case the abstract class is assumed to represent both the interface and part of the implementation. - the abstract type has only private constructors, in which case the type may just be a marker (to be used in annotations for example).
constraint.cypher: // Abstract types without an "Abstract" prefix in their name that implement a meaningful interface MATCH (type:Type:HibernateSearch)-[:EXTENDS|IMPLEMENTS *]->(interface:Interface:HibernateSearch) <-[:CONTAINS]-(interfaceArtifact:Maven:Artifact) WHERE type.abstract AND NOT type.nameWithoutContainingTypeName =~ "^Abstract.*" // Exceptions AND NOT interfaceArtifact.name STARTS WITH "hibernate-search-util-" // Exclude types that have only private constructors OPTIONAL MATCH (type)-[:DECLARES]->(nonPrivateConstructor:Constructor) WHERE // Ignore synthetic constructors NOT nonPrivateConstructor.synthetic AND nonPrivateConstructor.visibility <> 'private' WITH type, count(nonPrivateConstructor) = 0 AS hasOnlyPrivateConstructors WHERE NOT hasOnlyPrivateConstructors RETURN type

constraint.description: Types extending/implementing a Hibernate Search type from another module must have a module-specific keyword in their name, either at the very start or just after "Abstract". This allows to more easily understand which module a given type comes from. Exceptions are allowed when: - the misnamed type is an anonymous type, a generated type or a test type; - or the misnamed type is an inner/nested type named "(Abstract)?Builder" and its parent type does use the module-specific keyword; - or the implemented type is in a util module, in which case the implemented interface may just be a detail.
constraint.cypher: MATCH (misnamedTypeArtifact:Maven:Artifact)-[:CONTAINS]->(misnamedType:Type) -[:IMPLEMENTS|EXTENDS *]-> (externalParentType:Type:HibernateSearch)<-[:CONTAINS]-(externalParentTypeArtifact:Maven:Artifact) WHERE misnamedTypeArtifact <> externalParentTypeArtifact // Abstract<Keyword><something> or <Keyword><something> // Ignore the containing type for inner/nested types AND NOT misnamedType.nameWithoutContainingTypeName =~ ("^(Abstract)?\\Q" + misnamedTypeArtifact.moduleSpecificKeyword + "\\E.*") // Exceptions AND NOT misnamedType:Anonymous AND NOT misnamedType:Generated AND NOT misnamedType:Test AND NOT ( misnamedType.nameWithoutContainingTypeName =~ "^(Abstract)?Builder$" AND misnamedType.name =~ ("^(Abstract)?\\Q" + misnamedTypeArtifact.moduleSpecificKeyword + "\\E.*") ) AND NOT externalParentTypeArtifact.name STARTS WITH "hibernate-search-util-" RETURN misnamedTypeArtifact.moduleSpecificKeyword, misnamedType, externalParentType

constraint.description: The simple (non-qualified) name of public Hibernate Search types should be unique. Exceptions are only allowed when the two types sharing an identical name: - are located in two modules that do not depend on each other - or are deprecated (at least one of them) - or are both nested types.
constraint.cypher: MATCH (artifact1:Maven:Artifact)-[:DEPENDS_ON *0]->(artifact2:Maven:Artifact) MATCH (artifact1:Maven:Artifact)-[:CONTAINS]->(type1:Type:HibernateSearch:Public) MATCH (artifact2:Maven:Artifact)-[:CONTAINS]->(type2:Type:HibernateSearch:Public) WHERE type1 <> type2 AND type1.nameWithoutContainingTypeName = type2.nameWithoutContainingTypeName AND NOT (type1.name =~ ".*\\$.*" AND type2.name =~ ".*\\$.*") AND NOT (type1:Deprecated OR type2:Deprecated) RETURN type1, type2

constraint.description: Packages should not have cyclic dependencies. The following types are ignored when computing dependency paths: - logging-related types.
constraint.cypher: // First pass to compute inter-package dependencies, which is faster than inter-type dependencies MATCH (a1:Maven:Artifact)-[:CONTAINS]->(p1:Package:HibernateSearch) -[:DEPENDS_ON]-> (p2:Package:HibernateSearch)<-[:CONTAINS]-(a2:Maven:Artifact), packagePath=allShortestPaths((p2)-[:DEPENDS_ON*..20]->(p1)) // Optimize: only look for path with 20 hops or less WHERE p1<>p2 AND a1=a2 // Optimize: we consider there are no cyclic dependencies between artifacts AND NOT p1.fqn CONTAINS "logging" AND NOT p2.fqn CONTAINS "logging" AND ALL ( p IN nodes(packagePath) WHERE NOT p.fqn CONTAINS "logging" AND ((a1)-[:CONTAINS]->(p)) // Optimize: we consider there are no cyclic dependencies between artifacts ) // Second pass to compute inter-type dependencies, which are easier to understand MATCH (p1)-[:CONTAINS]->(t1:Type:HibernateSearch)-[:DEPENDS_ON]->(t2:Type:HibernateSearch)<-[:CONTAINS]-(p2:Package), typePath=allShortestPaths((t2)-[:DEPENDS_ON*..20]->(t1)) // Optimize: only look for path with 20 hops or less WHERE t1<>t2 AND ALL ( t IN nodes(typePath) WHERE ANY ( p IN nodes(packagePath) WHERE ((p)-[:CONTAINS]->(t)) // Optimize: only consider types from packages in the cyclic path ) ) RETURN DISTINCT a1.name AS Artifact, p1.fqn AS Package, EXTRACT(t IN nodes(typePath) | t.fqn) AS Cycle ORDER BY Package

constraint.description: Unit test class names must be suffixed with "Test".
constraint.cypher: MATCH (artifact:Maven:Artifact:HibernateSearch) -[:CONTAINS]->(type:Type)-[:DECLARES]->(method:Method) -[:ANNOTATED_BY]->()-[:OF_TYPE]->(testAnnotation:Type) WHERE NOT artifact:IntegrationTest AND testAnnotation.fqn = "org.junit.Test" AND NOT type.name ENDS WITH "Test" RETURN DISTINCT artifact.name AS Artifact, type.fqn AS Test

constraint.description: Integration test class names must be suffixed with "IT".
constraint.cypher: MATCH (artifact:Maven:Artifact:HibernateSearch:IntegrationTest) -[:CONTAINS]->(type:Type)-[:DECLARES]->(method:Method) -[:ANNOTATED_BY]->()-[:OF_TYPE]->(testAnnotation:Type) WHERE testAnnotation.fqn = "org.junit.Test" AND NOT type.name ENDS WITH "IT" RETURN DISTINCT artifact.name AS Artifact, type.fqn AS Test

constraint.description: ".impl" packages must be leaves: they must not have any sub-package. Exceptions are only allowed for: - org.hibernate.search.util.impl
constraint.cypher: MATCH (artifact:Maven:Artifact:HibernateSearch) -[:CONTAINS]->(package:Package) WHERE package.fqn =~ ".*\\.impl\\..*" AND NOT package.fqn STARTS WITH "org.hibernate.search.util.impl" RETURN DISTINCT artifact.name AS Artifact, package.fqn AS Package
